meanings.definition: The act of closing or shutting something.
meanings.sent1: The closures of the store happen every evening.
meanings.sent2: She used the closures on the door to keep it shut.
meanings.sent3: The closures of the book were so loud, they startled the cat.
meanings.sent4: The closures of the play left the audience in awe.
meanings.sent5: The closures of the gate were rusty and hard to move.

meanings.definition: A device or piece of material used to close something.
meanings.sent1: He fixed the closures on the window to keep it secure.
meanings.sent2: The closures on the bag kept her belongings safe.
meanings.sent3: The closures on the jacket were shaped like little hearts.
meanings.sent4: The closures on the necklace sparkled in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The closures on the box were difficult to open.

meanings.definition: The process of bringing something to an end or conclusion.
meanings.sent1: The closures of the meeting signaled the end of the day.
meanings.sent2: The closures of the project were met with relief.
meanings.sent3: The closures of the story left everyone wanting more.
meanings.sent4: The closures of the event marked a successful finish.
meanings.sent5: The closures of the chapter left a sense of accomplishment.
